description: This file contains multiple Flutter widget classes that define screens and UI components for a cinematic TV interface application. It includes screens like DetailsScreen, SearchScreen, WatchlistScreen, and SettingsScreen, along with shared UI elements such as custom buttons and focus handling logic. The code manages UI layout, focus traversal, interactivity, and navigation integration within the app.

classes.name: DetailsScreen
classes.description: Screen displaying detailed information about a selected media item, including title, overview, and focusable action buttons.

classes.name: _DetailsButtons
classes.description: Private widget containing focusable 'Play' and 'Add to Watchlist' buttons on the DetailsScreen.

classes.name: SearchScreen
classes.description: Screen with a focusable search input and list of recent searches or search results, supporting D-pad navigation.

classes.name: _SearchFieldStub
classes.description: Private widget simulating a search input field, focusable and activatable via D-pad.

classes.name: WatchlistScreen
classes.description: Screen listing bookmarked media items with focusable 'Remove' buttons.

classes.name: _WatchlistRow
classes.description: Private widget representing a single item in the watchlist with focus handling.

classes.name: SettingsScreen
classes.description: Configurable settings screen with a list of options, each focusable and activatable.

classes.name: _SettingsTile
classes.description: Private widget for individual settings options with focus and interaction features.

classes.name: _FilledTvButton
classes.description: Custom focusable button with filled background style used for action buttons.

classes.name: _OutlinedTvButton
classes.description: Custom focusable button with outline style used for secondary actions.

classes.name: _SearchFieldStub
classes.description: Simulated search field widget, focusable and interactable, used in SearchScreen.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Constructs the widget tree for each screen, arranging layouts, interactive elements, and focus behavior.

methods.name: dispose
methods.description: Cleans up focus nodes and other resources when widgets are disposed.

methods.name: onActivate / onPressed / onActivate
methods.description: Callbacks triggered by user interactions with buttons or focusable components, performing navigation, search, or state updates.
